SENT.plain: We report the case of a 83-year-old female patient with ST elevation myocardial infarction who developed a rectus sheath hematoma during treatment with antiplatelet medication and systemic anticoagulants following cough attacks
The patient presented with progressive pain in the left lower abdomen associated with a palpable mass and anaemia
Abdominal sonography and computed tomography revealed a rectus sheath hematoma
We discuss pathogenesis, clinical findings, diagnostic workup and therapy
Moreover, we review the current related literature
